dependencies.description: Autoconf -- system configuration part of autotools
dependencies.name: autoconf

dependencies.description: Automake -- make file builder part of autotools
dependencies.name: automake

dependencies.description:
GDAL: Geospatial Data Abstraction Library. GDAL is a translator library
for raster and vector geospatial data formats that is released under an
MIT style Open Source License by the Open Source Geospatial Foundation.
As a library, it presents a single raster abstract data model and single
vector abstract data model to the calling application for all supported
formats. It also comes with a variety of useful command line utilities
for data translation and processing.
dependencies.name: gdal

dependencies.description:
GNU Make is a tool which controls the generation of executables and
other non-source files of a program from the program's source files.
dependencies.name: gmake

dependencies.description:
The GNU config.guess and config.sub scripts versioned by timestamp.
This package can be used as a build dependency for autotools packages
that ship a tarball with outdated config.guess and config.sub files.
dependencies.name: gnuconfig

dependencies.description:
HDF5 is a data model, library, and file format for storing and managing
data. It supports an unlimited variety of datatypes, and is designed for
flexible and efficient I/O and for high volume and complex data.
dependencies.name: hdf5

dependencies.description:
MozJPEG is a patched version of libjpeg-turbo which improves JPEG
compression efficiency achieving higher visual quality and smaller file
sizes at the same time
dependencies.name: jpeg

dependencies.description:
GeoTIFF represents an effort by over 160 different remote sensing, GIS,
cartographic, and surveying related companies and organizations to
establish a TIFF based interchange format for georeferenced raster
imagery.
dependencies.name: libgeotiff

dependencies.description:
libharu - free PDF library. Haru is a free, cross platform, open-sourced
software library for generating PDF.
dependencies.name: libharu

dependencies.description: libSM - X Session Management Library.
dependencies.name: libsm

dependencies.description: libtool -- library building part of autotools.
dependencies.name: libtool

dependencies.description: GNU M4 is an implementation of the traditional Unix macro processor.
dependencies.name: m4

dependencies.description:
OpenCV (Open Source Computer Vision Library) is an open source computer
vision and machine learning software library.
dependencies.name: opencv

dependencies.description:
PostgreSQL is a powerful, open source object-relational database system.
It has more than 15 years of active development and a proven
architecture that has earned it a strong reputation for reliability,
data integrity, and correctness.
dependencies.name: postgresql

dependencies.description:
PROJ is a generic coordinate transformation software, that transforms
geospatial coordinates from one coordinate reference system (CRS) to
another. This includes cartographic projections as well as geodetic
transformations.
dependencies.name: proj

dependencies.description: The Python programming language.
dependencies.name: python

dependencies.description: A Spack managed Python virtual environment
dependencies.name: python-venv

dependencies.description:
SWIG is an interface compiler that connects programs written in C and
C++ with scripting languages such as Perl, Python, Ruby, and Tcl. It
works by taking the declarations found in C/C++ header files and using
them to generate the wrapper code that scripting languages need to
access the underlying C/C++ code. In addition, SWIG provides a variety
of customization features that let you tailor the wrapping process to
suit your application.
dependencies.name: swig

dependencies.description:
ODBC is an open specification for providing application developers with
a predictable API with which to access Data Sources. Data Sources
include SQL Servers and any Data Source with an ODBC Driver.
dependencies.name: unixodbc

dependencies.description:
wxWidgets is a C++ library that lets developers create applications for
Windows, Mac OS X, Linux and other platforms with a single code base. It
has popular language bindings for Python, Perl, Ruby and many other
languages, and unlike other cross-platform toolkits, wxWidgets gives
applications a truly native look and feel because it uses the platform's
native API rather than emulating the GUI. It's also extensive, free,
open-source and mature.
dependencies.name: wxwidgets

description:
SAGA is a GIS for Automated Geoscientific Analyses and has been
designed for an easy and effective implementation of spatial algorithms.
It offers a comprehensive, growing set of geoscientific methods and
provides an easily approachable user interface with many visualisation
options
name: saga-gis

variants.description: Build systems supported by the package
variants.name: build_system

variants.description: Build GUI and interactive SAGA tools
variants.name: gui

variants.description: Build with libfire (non free for commercial usage)
variants.name: libfire
